summary:
Malaria is a serious disease caused by tiny parasites spread by mosquito bites. It mainly affects people in tropical areas, especially in Africa. Symptoms include fever, tiredness, and headaches, and it can be deadly if not treated.

To stay safe, people can use mosquito nets and repellents. Medicines can also prevent malaria for those traveling to risky areas. Two vaccines are now available, and treating malaria usually involves a combination of powerful medicines.

In 2022, millions of people got malaria, and many died, mostly young children. Fighting malaria is crucial for global health and economic growth.
title: Malaria
